data.title: Halloween Film Series at the UGL – Library Community
data.text:
Starting October 10: October Film Series at the UGL

Date: Wednesdays in October @ 8p.m.

Location: Bernath Auditorium, UGL

Free for current students, faculty, and staff!

OCTOBER 10

Les Diaboliques

1955 | NR | 1 hr 58 mins

95% on Rotten Tomatoes

From director Henri-Georges Clouzot comes this now-classic French thriller that helped to inspire Psycho. Véra Clouzot and Simone Signoret star as the wife and mistress of an abusive boarding school headmaster; the two plot their revenge, but strange events around the school hint that things are not as they appear.

In French with English subtitles

OCTOBER 17

What We Do in the Shadows

2014 | R | 1 hr 26 mins

96% on Rotten Tomatoes

This mockumentary follows four vampire roommates living in present-day Wellington, New Zealand, and stars writer/directors Taika Waititi and Jemaine Clement. The centuries-old quartet bring in a camera crew to film their attempts to navigate 21st century life, werewolves, vampire hunters, and (of course) nightclubs.

OCTOBER 24

Black Sunday

1960 | NR | 1 hr 27 mins

85% on Rotten Tomatoes

The debut of Italian director Mario Bava and also released under the title The Mask of Satan, this is considered one of the most influential films in horror cinema. In 17th century Moldavia a witch is put to death by her brother. As she dies, she curses her brother and all of his descendants; two centuries later the curse takes effect.

OCTOBER 31

Night of the Living Dead

1968 | NR | 1 hr 36 mins

97% on Rotten Tomatoes
